messages.title: Uniting for a stronger East End
messages.content: I'll unite our community for a fairer, safer and stronger East End... a place with better housing, greater opportunity and a reliable NHS.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: End the scandal of housing, get better protection for renters, scrap the bedroom tax.
Invest an extra £2.5 billion, train 20,000 more nurses and 8,000 new doctors.
Raise the minimum wage to £8/hour and end exploitative zero-hour contracts.
Work for safer, greener and cleaner communities, improve rubbish collection and recycling, reduce carbon emissions.
Invest in schools, cut tuition fees and guarantee a job or training for young people out of work for over a year.

issues.health: Invest an extra £2.5 billion into NHS, train more nurses and doctors.

housing.content: End the scandal of housing, better protection for renters, scrap the bedroom tax.

leaflet.personalStatement: Since being elected in 2010, I have been proud to represent the area I grew up in.

politicalExperience.achievements: Secured funding for better housing, schools, and health; campaigned for social issues; opposed government cuts affecting local services; advocated for international cooperation on climate change; united people for remittance giving; campained for public recognition of Palestinian statehood; advocated for improvements in governance.

images.caption: Rushanara Ali with local people and community efforts.
